messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] sitting at machine..don't
messages.messageBody:
--- Beckyleach@... wrote:
<<
> My problem right now is that I'm physically unable
> to sit at a sewing
> machine long

Becky
Perhaps if you try something small, like receiveing
blanket sized quilt that is hand quilted. Or maybe a
tiny comforter? Or hand applique'? On any small sized
project. Not necessarily for any purpose, but just to
make. Art doesn't have to have a reason.

Prayers for you to have more stamina
Sharon

__________________________________________________

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1273
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 05/28/2001 3:50:05 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 05/28/2001 3:50:05 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
My problem right now is that I'm physically unable to sit at a sewing
machine long enough to create the quilt top or even cut out the pieces! I'm
on the look out for some great pictures in outline or quilting designs I
like well enough to have BE the quilt design. Then I'll just put the top,
bottom and batting together and enjoy the quilting process (If I don't
expect to accomplish it quickly I can do the quilting part). >>

I saw a beautiful quilt like this at the Iowa State Fair one year, and it
had won "best of show", too: pure white fabric with extraordinarily
intricate quilting in white thread. Minimal, but breathtaking..... :-)

Becky

*** Becky***

"Nothing in all the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and
conscientious stupidity."

Martin Luther King Jr. (1929 - 1968), Strength to Love, 1963
